Hi,

I am new to this group, so if there is a FAQ or thread that addresses 
this, please direct me appropriately.

I wrote a comprehensive set of tests in jUnit that run under Maven. Now, 
these run against a single backend and now several developers in my 
group would like to use these tests against other backends to test them. 
The most natural way to do this is with the test suite mechanism in 
jUnit. That is to say, make up a suite that requires merely that the 
backend be set and test away. Or so I thought.

The different backends are different projects in our group and live in 
different Maven modules.

The problem is that making a suite using annotations does not really 
work so well. The annotations are not inherited. The other solution 
which is to have the developers make their own suites by annotations is 
also very clunky and will probably break at some point.

So here is my question: Is there any way to make a test suite that is a 
harness and can be reused? 

I assume that jUnit 3.8's method of explicitly creating a suite is going 
to get deprecated soon, right? So that would be a deadend. Also, are 
their plans to make annotations inheritable at some point in jUnit? We 
could maybe live with cutting and pasting for the short term if we knew 
that this issue would get resolved at some point.

Thanks!

Jeff
